meanings.definition: Fail to honor a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: He was welshing on his promise to pay back the money.
meanings.sent2: She kept welshing on her agreement to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat was welshing on its duty to catch mice.
meanings.sent4: The sun welshed on its promise to shine all day.
meanings.sent5: The student welshed on studying for the test, and failed.

meanings.definition: To renege on a promise or agreement.
meanings.sent1: They were welshing on their commitment to attend the event.
meanings.sent2: He welshed on his agreement to share the prize.
meanings.sent3: The puppy welshed on its promise not to chew the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The clouds welshed on their agreement to bring rain to the parched land.
meanings.sent5: She welshed on her pledge to always be there for her friend.
